title: Indigo’s ancient blue rises from Himalaya’s foothills to AOI walls: Tracing pigment’s journey from leaf to cloth, colonial past to sustainable future
description: Kiran Sandhu transforms old fabrics into 'Landscapes Of Indigo' over years of careful cultivation and dyeing. Her farm-to-fabric enterprise in Uttarakhand revives natural indigo, reclaiming its purity and highlighting the value of labor and patience. Sandhu's work showcases the ancient color's vibrant potential, contrasting with synthetic dyes.

title: Ancient Rome meets modern technology as tourists visit restored, frescoed home via livestream tours
description: ROME (AP) -- One of the best-preserved ancient Roman homes on the Palatine Hill is opening to the public for the first time, albeit via a livestreamed tour of its hard-to-reach underground frescoes and mosaics. The House of the Griffins was first discovered during the excavations in the early 20th century of the Palatine Hill, the verdant hill that rises up from the Roman Forum and dominates views of central Rome today with its striking red brick ruins. title: A Mighty Ancient Ocean Shaped Central Asia's Landscape
description: New research from Adelaide University suggests the power of the ancient Tethys Ocean might have shaped Central Asia's topography during the Cretaceous period.

title: Beneath a modern Chinese metropolis, an ancient capital emerges
